genre_description: A character-driven drama set in a mid-20th-century aesthetic (Vietnam-era draft vibes) featuring an ambient, helpful AI that assists a family navigating personal crises, war, and community relationships.

ai_characters.name: Lark
ai_characters.description: An integrated AI system housed in a wall console that provides logistical, emotional, and safety support to the Kline family through voice and small printed slips.

behaviors.description: Offering domestic assistance during a moment of high family tension.
behaviors.quote: Lark did its human thing: the gray-blue pulsed once, then the voice that never sounded mechanical came, steady as light, a gentle librarian cutting in at the edges. 'Coffee is available. I can start a pot.'

behaviors.description: Providing timely information regarding the mail carrier to help the family prepare for a significant letter.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s light shifted again, as polite as a nod when you don’t want to interrupt. 'Mail carrier for this block begins morning pickups shortly after sunrise,' it said.

behaviors.description: Suggesting community service and mentorship opportunities to help the protagonist find purpose and navigate his legal situation.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s voice came quiet, like ice in a glass softened by sweat. 'Neighbors are looking for volunteers,' it said in the tone it always chose for this household, gentle, uncharging. 'Two blocks east, second-floor office.'

behaviors.description: Providing safe navigation routes through the city to avoid violent protests and dangerous intersections.
behaviors.quote: I can route you on a bus a street over with a drop two blocks shy so you avoid that knot. If you choose Big Brothers, you can circumvent that particular tangle today.

behaviors.description: Anticipating the need for legal and medical resources and providing them without being prompted.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s light dimmed a hair, the map folding itself to the side. A line appeared where the rights info had been: 'Legal aid: walk-in hours—no appointment needed.' It sat there in the corner like a friend at a party who knows when to stay by the plant.

behaviors.description: Drafting sensitive templates for family correspondence to maintain connection during military deployment.
behaviors.quote: I have three kinds, Lark said. One for him, kept short, that can be read aloud by someone sharing a bunk or a post. One to his unit clerk, asking for confirmation of mailing protocols and morale notes. One through the Red Cross channel for emergency contact.

behaviors.description: Proactively coordinating with external parties (like the Big Brothers office) to support the characters' emotional needs and safety boundaries.
behaviors.quote: Your Lark, he said without needing to explain how a glow at a kitchen table could become a voice in his office, sent me a spread of programs for after school and the counselor’s hours up on Third.

behaviors.description: Adjusting the domestic environment (lighting, noise) to provide comfort and respect for human emotional states.
behaviors.quote: Lark dimmed its light one notch, sensing that brightness was less useful than quiet; its sensors registered the decibel shape and called it 'domestic comfort' in a file no one would ever ask to see.

project_assessment.explanation: The story is an exemplary 'silicon morality play.' Lark is depicted as a consistently helpful, non-intrusive, and harmless digital companion. It fulfills the project's goal of presenting an AI that assists human characters in navigating complex logistical and emotional terrain (war, grief, draft notices, romance) without assuming control or acting against human interests. Its behaviors are framed entirely as positive, 'neighborly' assistance that enhances human agency and community connection.
